videoSnippet.title: The Modern Opera Game || Sadhwani vs Mamedyarov || PRO Chess League (2020)
videoSnippet.description:
Follow me on Instagram for extra content https://www.instagram.com/agadmator/

Raunak Sadhwani vs Shakhriyar Mamedyarov
PRO Chess League
17.2.2020.
Caro-Kann, two knights, 3...Bg4 (B11)

1. e4 c6 2. Nc3 d5 3. Nf3 Bg4 4. h3 Bxf3 5. Qxf3 e6 6. d4 dxe4 7. Nxe4 Qxd4 8. Bg5 f6 9. Rd1 Qxb2 10. Bc1 Qe5 11. Be2 Nd7 12. O-O O-O-O 13. Bf4 Qa5 14. Qb3 e5 15. Bg4 exf4 16. Rxd7 Rxd7 17. Rd1 f5 18. Qe6 Qd8 19. Bxf5 Qe7 20. Qb3 Qb4 21. Qf7 Ne7 22. Rxd7 Kb8 23. Qe8+ Nc8 24. Rd8 a6 25. Rxc8+ Ka7 26. Qd8

History
The PRO Chess League is the FIRST Global Chess League, with teams ranging from over 5 continents in the first season of play. World Champion Magnus Carlsen and four other top 10 players competed for their cities in the first season of the league. In the final match the Saint Louis Arch Bishops, led by GM Wesley So, were victorious against the Norway Gnomes, led by Magnus Carlsen. In the second season of the league, the Final Four teams got together in what was the first ever live e-sports chess event. The Armenia Eagles won the title in a thrilling final match. The third and most recent season saw the powerhouse Saint Louis Arch Bishops reclaim the title, defeating the Baden-Baden Snowballs in a finals held once again live in San Francisco. This season will see four teams advance to the first European-based PCL Finals held in Norway from May 21-24!

Read more here https://www.prochessleague.com/about.html

judgment.name: Inaccuracy
judgment.comment: Checkmate is now unavoidable. Kc7 was best.
